CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 30, 1962, pg. 1, reads: "Where Fire Took Life - Shown are the scorched remains of two houses in Wickhaven, Pa., near Perryopolis, where 43-year-old Mace Copland was burned to death. Though rescued from the flames, the man died before he could be transported to the hospital.  Twenty others, all except one being members of the Copland family, were left homeless by the blaze that raged for two and a half hours in remote community. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Men, women, and children standing on rural road beside foundations of two burned houses, in Wickhaven, Pennsylvania, another version
